tsp

Class Vertex

  • java.lang.Object
    • tsp.Vertex

  • public class Vertex
extends java.lang.Object
    A Vertex represents a point which should get perambulated.
    Author:
    Roman Boegli

        nX - x coordinate (latitude)
        nY - y coordinate (longitude)

      • Vertex

              double nX,
              double nY,
              double nZ)
        constructor III, used to initiate vertices
        Parameters:
        cName - name of the vertex
        nX - x coordinate (latitude)
        nY - y coordinate (longitude)
        nZ - z coordinate (height)

    • Method Detail

      • getRandom

        public static Vertex getRandom(double nXmin,
                               double nXmax,
                               double nYmin,
                               double nYmax,
                               double nZmin,
                               double nZmax)
        initiates a random vertex
        Parameters:
        nXmin - x coordinate's lower bound
        nXmax - x coordinate's upper bound
        nYmin - y coordinate's lower bound
        nYmax - y coordinate's upper bound
        nZmin - z coordinate's lower bound
        nZmax - z coordinate's upper bound
        Returns:
        randomly generated Vertex

        public java.lang.Double[] getCoordinates()
        retrieves the coordinates of the vertex and returns it as a Double array
        Returns:

      • getInfo

        public java.lang.String getInfo()
        method used to get detailed information about a vertex in form of a one line string.
        Returns:
        name, x-, y- and z-coordinate as a one line info string

      • getDistanceToCH1903

        public double getDistanceToCH1903(Vertex v)
        Calculates the distance between two vertices with help of the Pythagorean Theorem. Only applicable when working with the CH1903 or CH1903+ coordinate system (Swiss Grid).
        Parameters:
        v - aimed vertex to which the distance should be calculated
        Returns:
        distance to Vertex 'v' as a double value

      • getDistanceToWGS

        public double getDistanceToWGS(Vertex v)
        Calculates the distance between two vertices with help of the Pythagorean Theorem plus taking the height into account. Only applicable when working with the WGS coordinate system (World Grid). source: https://goo.gl/24SHHA (David George)
        Parameters:
        v - aimed vertex to which the distance should be calculated
        Returns:
        distance to Vertex 'v' as double
